data.title: Windows 10 mobile: touch locations are offseted
data.body:
Hi,

creating and executing a MonoGame project in Windows 10 mobile (with templates from the latest build) makes the touch locations offseted, probably due to the top bar. Problem appears both in portrait and landscape (offset amount changes though)

Minimal sample showing the problem: http://pastebin.com/pSDQR1U5

data.title: Added DrawIndexedPrimitives overload
data.body: I marked this method as obsolete, hints are not used either in opengl and dx11. I added new overload which does not accept hints.

data.title: Reset ScreenReceiver.ScreenLocked in OnDestroy()
Monogame for Windows using DX's MediaPlayer mute only one song.
data.body:
While using Mediaplayer to play songs in my game, developed in monogame for windows using DX I have encountered a bug where only one song will mute/unmute when changing the MediaPlayer.IsMuted property but as soon as I play another song using the MediaPlayer, the mute will no longer work, and the music will keep playing. the same thing happens when using the Volume Property, mute will sieze to work as song as a new song is played.

its something like that:
MediaPlayer.Play(Song1);
MediaPlayer.IsMuted = true; //Mute just fine
MediaPlayer.Stop();
MediaPlayer.Play(Song2); //Game will unmute the song, playing the song in full volume.
MediaPlayer.IsMuted = true; //This line will not work, the song wont mute.

any ideas on how to solve it?

Edit:
The origion of the problem is a bug in the MediaPlayer class in MonoGame 3.4 Build.
To solve the problem download a newer build (3.5 Unstable or higher).

data.title: Fix for XAudio crashing if any instance is playing while parent is disposed
data.body:
This is a fix proposal for #4093

If a `SoundEffect` is disposed while a `SoundEffectInstance` of that effect is playing, it results in an XAudio crash (and possibly other audio implementations).

This fix stops all playing instances upon an effect disposal (and return them to the pool).

It doesn't concern `SoundEffectInstance` created through `SoundEffect.CreateInstance()`, assuming that these instances life-cycle management are up to the developer. (How does XNA behave regarding these? I don't remember having this kind of issue back then.)

If this fix gets merged, `SoundEffectInstancePool.Update()` could be a bit cleaned, since the check of disposed effects would no more be useful.

data.title: Add credits to the original author of OggStreamer
data.body: Just to mention, it was modified from the original version, don't know if it's important.

data.title: XAudio crashes if a SoundEffectInstance is playing while disposing the SoundEffect
data.body:
I noticed that XAudio (and possible other implementations) would crash if a `SoundEffectInstance` is playing while its parent `SoundEffect` is being disposed or unloaded via `ContentManager.Unload()`.

I have a temp fix (see https://github.com/mrhelmut/MonoGame/tree/SoundEffectDisposeFix) that stops any playing/paused pooled `SoundEffectInstance` before the disposal of their `SoundEffect`, and returns them to the pool. But that doesn't concern non-pooled instances.

What do you guys think about this? ( @tomspilman @KonajuGames ?) Should all pooled and non-pooled instances of a given `SoundEffect` be stopped? Or do one consider that non-pooled instances (via `SoundEffect.CreateInstance`) life-cycle is up to the developer?

Let me know what you think and if I should push that fix or rework it.

data.title: Fix for songs sometimes not playing (Windows DirectX)
data.body:
I've had some issues with the Windows DirectX build where songs sometimes didn't play as follows:
- On my Win7 desktop, the problem only happened occasionally and was difficult to reproduce. When it did happen, the song would start playing but then stop very shortly after.
- On my Win10 laptop, the problem was much easier to reproduce. Basically I'd play a song, stop it, play another song, stop it, and then play the first song again (which would then not start playing at all).

I believe issues #1954 and #3884 are related (and likely will be resolved by this PR and/or my previous PR #4044).

This was quite a pain to resolve (I spent the past 2 days working on it)... Eventually it mostly came down to cross threading issues, not waiting for asynchronous methods to complete when required, and unnecessary/incorrect use of some MediaSession functions.

Anyway, it should hopefully be a lot cleaner and more robust now. I have not been able to reproduce the issues I was having, so I believe they're resolved now.

VideoPlayer.WMS will most likely need similar fixes (since it uses the same APIs), but I don't have anything that uses it and can't afford the time to investigate further. If there are similar issues though, hopefully someone else can just look at what I've done here to resolve them.

data.title: Remove PSMoble From Docs
data.body: Remove depreciated PSMoble from doc generation which was missed in https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/pull/4016.

data.title: Pull Request for Issue #3186 Content Processor Updates
data.body: Updated ContentTypeReaderManager to make type resolutions for ContentTypeReaders significantly more robust.

data.title: Added VertexBufferBinding struct.
data.body: This struct is used in various parts of GraphicsDevice and with instanced rendering, for example : GraphicsDevice.SetVertexBuffers([bindings]) - DrawInstancedPrimitives(which is not implemented yet). I think the addition of this XNA struct is important for progress in this direction. The link to the XNA definition - https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/microsoft.xna.framework.graphics.vertexbufferbinding.aspx

data.title: SpriteBatch Sort Garbage
data.body:
I'm fairly certain that the sorting code in SpriteBatch is generating garbage.  Take a look at this code:

https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/blob/develop/MonoGame.Framework/Graphics/SpriteBatcher.cs#L215

The `List<T>.Sort(...)` there takes a delegate as it shows in the doc:

https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/w56d4y5z(v=vs.110).aspx

This means on each batch sort we are allocating a delegate to pass to the sort then throwing it away.

Not sure if this can be fixed by allocating the delegate and storing it or if we should use one of the other overloads for `Sort` which doesn't generate garbage.

data.title: So what about reference docs ?
data.body: I still dont know, can I continue to write the docs ? @tomspilman, @KonajuGames ?

data.title: Fix for songs occasionally stopping shortly after starting (Windows DirectX)
data.body:
I noticed in the Windows DirectX build that occasionally when playing a song, it would stop very shortly after starting.

It turns out that the previous fix I did (PR #4044) was almost there, but not quite. Apparently you are also not meant to start the session until the topology is ready.

So I've fixed this up and it seems to work reliably now. I also applied the same fix to VideoPlayer.WMS this time.

While I was working on this area of code, I took the liberty of doing some minor refactoring to make it simpler and more readable. I hope this is ok.

data.title: Don't limit the amount of GamePads that can be used
data.body: I am pretty sure that XInput is the only thing that actually has the limit of 4 gamepads... no point in limiting the rest because of it...

data.title: API for drawing basic shapes
data.body:
One thing that always bugged me about XNA is that it doesn't have a way of drawing basic shapes very easily. We may want to implement some extra methods to SpriteBatch like DrawCircle, DrawRectangle, etc.

@tomspilman @KonajuGames Thoughts?

data.title: Move Old Wiki Docs To MonoGame Docs
data.body:
We need one or more people to go thru the old wiki docs and decide what content there is worth moving over to the new MonoGame docs in the repo:

Old Wiki Docs: https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/wiki
New Docs: https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/tree/develop/Documentation

It should be done only a page or two at a time.  Please chime in here first if you plan to work on particular pages from the wiki.

Once the doc PR is merged we can delete those old pages from the wiki.  Eventually we should end up with an empty wiki simply pointing people to the official docs on the website.

data.title: XInput causes UWP projects to crash on mobile with .NET Native
data.body:
XInput works fine on desktop Windows 10, but causes an issue when the game is deployed to mobile. If .NET Native is not used (i.e. debug builds), it throws an exception:

```
Exception thrown: 'System.DllNotFoundException' in SharpDX.XInput.dll
```

A catch for this exception was added by @tomspilman:
https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/blob/develop/MonoGame.Framework/Input/GamePad.XInput.cs#L167

However, if .NET Native is used, the application simply fails to launch

```
The program '[5112] example.exe' has exited with code -1073741515 (0xc0000135) 'A dependent dll was not found'.
Activation of the Windows Store app 'example' failed with error 'The app didn't start'.
```

The issue was fixed by removing references to XInput (using GamePad.Default).

data.title: MediaPlayer.Volume adjustement only works on 1st played Song
data.body:
Hi there,

I am having problems adjusting the volume of songs while playing. I noticed that it works fine with the first Song played after app launch, but any subsequent song played can't have their volume changed (with the exception of `MediaPlayer.Volume = 0.0f` which correctly totally mutes the song).

Platform: WinDX.

Possible related issues: #3884

EDIT: it seems to be a problem with the `MediaSession` and `MediaFactory.GetService(session, MediaServiceKeys.StreamVolume, AudioStreamVolumeGuid, out volumeObj);`. If I force the recreation of a new `MediaSession` at each play, it works. So it looks like there is a problem with retrieving the correct `AudioStreamVolume` for the given song stream. Most probably related to the fact that topology updates are async (and therefore still bound to the previous stream somehow when trying to retriever the stream volume controller).

Most XAudio2 media session impletations seem to re-create a session at every play because media session updates are async. So if you guys are OK with that, I can submit a PR that Shutdown media sessions upon stop and start a fresh one upon start.

It is also because of those async initialisations that getting the audio stream volume controller may fail (and needs to wait). I can clean that up and init it once the topology is correctly set (you can know that with the MediaEvent callback).

Let me know if that sound coherent.

data.title: Implement MeshBuilder
data.body:
We need to implement the `Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Graphics.MeshBuilder` class:

https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/microsoft.xna.framework.content.pipeline.graphics.meshbuilder.aspx

The implantation should include unit tests to verify it is working correctly.
